title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE Duo Are All Exposed Ahead of Launch
description: The pricing is one thing that has been revealed, and for many, it might be too high for "FE".
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: The pricing is one thing that has been revealed, and for many, it might be too high for "FE".
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. Android smartphones are convenient, but they're limited by their relatively small screens. That is the exact problem that foldables are attempting to solve, but even then, there are a lot of compromises that those devices make that mean they're still far away from actually being a replacement for tablets—yes, even tri-folds. That's why Android tablets are still doing their thing, and in the Android space, those who want tablets that perform excellently need to turn their sights towards Samsung (amongst others). The Galaxy Tab S10 FE series is expected to launch very soon, and ahead of that, here's essentially a complete glimpse into their specs. Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE Series Sticks to the Same Safe Style Image: Arsene Lupin on Twitter A tablet doesn't need to be a good-looking piece of tech. Compared to smartphones, they tend to be a lot more functional, either for those who want to use them to play games, watch videos on a bigger screen, or get work done. Besides, there's little that can be done to make a flat slab look sexy. In the case of the Tab S10 FE and Tab S10 FE+, their designs are very familiar. Image: Arsene Lupin on Twitter Image: Arsene Lupin on Twitter Don't expect anything drastically different, as both upcoming tablets are essentially the same as the devices in the main lineup, particularly the Galaxy Tab S10+. Sure, there's only one camera here, but just like the Tab S10+, they don't have a notch, opting instead for equal bezels all around. It's a simple look, but it works. I won't give Samsung any flak this time. The Tab S10 FE Specs Have Been Revealed in Full Thanks to leaker Arsene Lupin on X, we now have a complete look at the spec sheets of the Tab S10 FE and S10 FE+. Let's talk about them. Both devices will have 90Hz LCD displays, but the Tab S10 FE will measure at 10.9 inches while naturally, the Plus model will push that up to 13.1 inches. That's bigger than the regular Tab S10+. Both devices will turn to Samsung for a chip, which is the Exynos 1580, same as the Galaxy A56. You will have a 13MP camera on the back and a 12MP selfie camera on the front. Image: Arsene Lupin on Twitter An 8,000mAh battery will ship inside the Tab S10 FE, and the Tab S10 FE+ will use a 10,090mAh cell. Both will have 45W fast charging—necessary considering those battery capacities. The device will be available in either 128GB or 256GB storage variants, but you will thankfully be able to expand the storage with an SD card—after all, there are no space constraints to use as an excuse for not including a memory card slot. The Pricing Is on the Higher End of Business Samsung's FE, or Fan Edition, models tend to cut corners for the sake of affordability for Samsung “fans”. That's how it used to be, at least. These days, FE models might have pricing that doesn't quite make them the best choice, especially if you have no reservations about buying an older flagship device. 10 FE8/128 579 Euro12/256 6798/128 5G 67912/256 5G 77910 FE+8/128 74912/256 8498/128 5G 84912/256 5G 949— Arsène Lupin (@MysteryLupin) March 26, 2025 The same leaker revealed the pricing for the devices, and the Tab S10 FE will be starting at €579 while the Tab S10 FE+'s cheapest variant will be all the way at €749. That's a €50 price hike compared to the Tab S9 FE models, so that's not great. Getting 5G connectivity will cost an extra €100 regardless of the model or storage variant too. Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

Android smartphones are convenient, but they're limited by their relatively small screens. That is the exact problem that foldables are attempting to solve, but even then, there are a lot of compromises that those devices make that mean they're still far away from actually being a replacement for tablets—yes, even tri-folds.

That's why Android tablets are still doing their thing, and in the Android space, those who want tablets that perform excellently need to turn their sights towards Samsung (amongst others). The Galaxy Tab S10 FE series is expected to launch very soon, and ahead of that, here's essentially a complete glimpse into their specs.

Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE Series Sticks to the Same Safe Style

A tablet doesn't need to be a good-looking piece of tech. Compared to smartphones, they tend to be a lot more functional, either for those who want to use them to play games, watch videos on a bigger screen, or get work done. Besides, there's little that can be done to make a flat slab look sexy. In the case of the Tab S10 FE and Tab S10 FE+, their designs are very familiar.

Don't expect anything drastically different, as both upcoming tablets are essentially the same as the devices in the main lineup, particularly the Galaxy Tab S10+. Sure, there's only one camera here, but just like the Tab S10+, they don't have a notch, opting instead for equal bezels all around. It's a simple look, but it works. I won't give Samsung any flak this time.

The Tab S10 FE Specs Have Been Revealed in Full

Thanks to leaker Arsene Lupin on X, we now have a complete look at the spec sheets of the Tab S10 FE and S10 FE+. Let's talk about them.

Both devices will have 90Hz LCD displays, but the Tab S10 FE will measure at 10.9 inches while naturally, the Plus model will push that up to 13.1 inches. That's bigger than the regular Tab S10+. Both devices will turn to Samsung for a chip, which is the Exynos 1580, same as the Galaxy A56. You will have a 13MP camera on the back and a 12MP selfie camera on the front.

An 8,000mAh battery will ship inside the Tab S10 FE, and the Tab S10 FE+ will use a 10,090mAh cell. Both will have 45W fast charging—necessary considering those battery capacities. The device will be available in either 128GB or 256GB storage variants, but you will thankfully be able to expand the storage with an SD card—after all, there are no space constraints to use as an excuse for not including a memory card slot.

The Pricing Is on the Higher End of Business

Samsung's FE, or Fan Edition, models tend to cut corners for the sake of affordability for Samsung “fans”. That's how it used to be, at least. These days, FE models might have pricing that doesn't quite make them the best choice, especially if you have no reservations about buying an older flagship device.

The same leaker revealed the pricing for the devices, and the Tab S10 FE will be starting at €579 while the Tab S10 FE+'s cheapest variant will be all the way at €749. That's a €50 price hike compared to the Tab S9 FE models, so that's not great. Getting 5G connectivity will cost an extra €100 regardless of the model or storage variant too.

Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
